title: Humans are the bane of Google’s self-drive cars
text:
Welcome to your preview of The Times Subscribe now Humans are the bane of Google’s self-drive cars Google says its cars make roads safer Tony Avelar/AP Ben Hoyle Los Angeles   September 3 2015 
Driverless cars have encountered a hazard on the road to the future: cars with drivers. Robots can be programmed to observe the letter of the law but designers are finding that people tend not to drive by the book. They also make mistakes. 
Dmitri Dolgov, head of software for Google’s self-driving car project, said that one of the lessons he had learnt on the job was that drivers needed to become “less idiotic”.
